clinical_study.brief_title: Mini-fluid Challenge in Predicting Fluid Responsiveness During Prone Position Spine Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: The Effectiveness of Mini-fluid Challenge in Predicting Fluid Responsiveness During Prone Position Spine Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: Perioperative fluid management is crucial for patients' outcome. Muller et al developed a "Mini-fluid challenge method " to predict fluid responsiveness and the efficacy. The investigators design the study to investigate the effectiveness of mini-fluid challenge test in prone position surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: Perioperative fluid management is crucial for patients' outcome. Series of studies have indicated that adequate fluid management optimizes the cardiac out put, improves tissue perfusion, thus decrease the risk of postoperative morbidity. Muller et al developed a "Mini-fluid challenge method " to predict fluid responsiveness and the efficacy. To the best of our knowledge, the efficacy of the test was not discussed in the perioperative care in prone position surgery. The investigators design the study to investigate the effectiveness of mini-fluid challenge test in prone position surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of cardiac index after fluid loading
primary_outcome.description: interpretate the correlation of mini-fluid challenge and conventional fluid challenge

secondary_outcome.description: interpretate the correlation of PPV and conventional fluid challenge

other_outcome.description: interpretate the correlation of SVV and conventional fluid challenge
interpretate the correlation of PVI and conventional fluid challenge

arm_group.description: Fluid challenge test will be presented after induction of anesthesia at a steady state. Fluid challenge test includes 2 components: 100 ml colloid infusion in 1 min followed by 400 ml colloid infusion in 14 mins. Hemodynamic parameter after 1 minute of the end of the 1st and 2nd colloid infusion bolus will be collected. Applied colloid: hydroxyethyl starch

intervention.description: Mini-fluid challenge test with 100mL colloid infusion in 1 min

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: meet both of
1. Patients receiving scheduled prone position spine surgery
2. BMI 18.5~30 kg.m-2
Exclusion Criteria:
1. age younger then 20 yrs or elder than 80 yrs
2. pregnant women
3. patients in intensive care units
4. patients with the underlying disease including respiratory failure(FEV1/FVC < 70 % and FEV1 < 50%), heart failure(NYHA score =III„ÄÅIV), kidney failure(eGFR< 60 ml.min-1.1.73m-2), liver failure
5. patients with ongoing infection
